mods.abstract: Colossus of Rameses II, Temple of Amen at Luxor, East Thebes (New Kingdom Dynasty XIX); striding colossal statue of Rameses II wearing the nemes crown, indentified by cartouche incised upon kilt, stands between columns and ruins within the Temple of Amen; "Luxor. Rameses II. 1072. Photogr. Artistique G. Lekegian & Co" in white along bottom of print. (Number on object is 20/655).

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

mods.note: Gift of Marcia S. Young, McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture, The University of Tennessee
